Idiom (Godié): Kpɔ́n nìa kpɔ́n ɖa lé sà lé nìa wò.
Syntactic Structure & Grammatical Form: Fixed clause; comparative structure with parallelism.
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: Two people or things that are very similar in behavior or character.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Used across the Godié region to describe people who share traits; often said jokingly among friends.
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Godié): [kpɔ̃̀ níà kpɔ̃̀ ɗà lé sà lé níà wò]
First Example Sentence: Wà lé Kofi nìa Yao, kpɔ́n nìa kpɔ́n ɖa lé sà lé nìa wò.
Second Example Sentence: Ɓa lé nìa kpɔ́n ɖa lé sà lé nìa wò nìa kpɛ́.
Third Example Sentence: Mɔ̀ kpɛ́ nìa kpɔ́n ɖa lé sà lé nìa wò nìa kpɔ́ yé.

Idiom (Godié): Tɔ̀n lé ɓa kpɔ́ gɔ̀lì, nìa ɓa ɓa wò.
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: It is better to act than to talk.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Traditional Godié proverb passed down in oral teaching emphasizing responsibility and integrity.
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Godié): [tɔ̃̀ lé ɓà kpɔ́ gɔ̀lì níà ɓà ɓà wò]
First Example Sentence: Ɓa lé nìa tɔ̀n lé ɓa kpɔ́ gɔ̀lì, nìa ɓa ɓa wò nìa sà.
Second Example Sentence: Mɔ̀ kpɛ́ nìa ɓa lé kpɔ́ gɔ̀lì, nìa ɓa ɓa wò lé ɓa.
Third Example Sentence: Wà lé sà lé kpɔ́ gɔ̀lì, nìa ɓa lé kpɔ́ wò.

Idiom (Godié): Ɓa lé nìa kpɔ́ ɖa, kpɔ́n lé kpɛ́.
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: What you sow is what you reap.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Reflects the agricultural roots of Godié society emphasizing moral causality.
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Godié): [ɓà lé níà kpɔ́ ɗà kpɔ̃̀ lé kpɛ́]
First Example Sentence: Mɔ̀ kpɛ́ ɓa lé nìa kpɔ́ ɖa, kpɔ́n lé kpɛ́ lé wò.
Second Example Sentence: Ɓa lé kpɔ́ ɖa, kpɔ́n lé kpɛ́ nìa kpɔ́ wò lé gɔ́.
Third Example Sentence: Wà lé ɓa nìa kpɔ́ ɖa, kpɔ́n lé kpɛ́ yé.

Idiom (Godié): Kɔ́ kpɛ́ nìa ɖa, wò kpɛ́ gɔ́.
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: If you respect others, they will respect you.
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: Treat others as you wish to be treated.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Common in intergenerational conversations emphasizing respect and reciprocity.
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Godié): [kɔ́ kpɛ́ níà ɗà wò kpɛ́ gɔ́]

Third Example Sentence: Wà lé kɔ́ kpɛ́ nìa ɖa lé kpɛ́ gɔ́ lé wò.

Idiom (Godié): Ɓa lé nìa kpɔ́, yé nìa kpɛ́ sà.
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: Don’t judge a book by its cover.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Used in storytelling to caution against hasty judgment.
